basics.name: KaiRui Wang
basics.label: Beijing 101 High School Student
basics.summary: A high school student passionate about financial analysis, mathematical economics, and interdisciplinary research combining math and economics.

location.address: 3rd. Ring East Rd, Fengtai District, Beijing Shi, Beijing

Education.institution: Beijing No.101 High School International Department

Internship.name: BeiDou Navigation and Digital Twin Technologies, Inc.
Internship.summary: Learned programming and product development processes, tested navigation and digital twin products, contributing to successful product launches.

Internship.name: ZhongShan Music Hall Paid Word
Internship.summary: Coordinated concert schedules, managed equipment setup, ensured audience order, and assisted with ticket checks and seating arrangements. Performed 10+ concerts in the Hall

Projects.name: Mathematical Economic Modeling about the Company's Profit during the Pandemic (Published)
Projects.summary: Conducted research using PDE to analyze company recovery plans during COVID-19, resulting in a 10% profit increase while prioritizing employee health.
highlights: Proposed solutions implemented in Huawei Company
10% Profit increase and innovative work recovering approach

Projects.name: Intelligent Blackboard Innovation(Launched)
Projects.summary: Designed and developed an automatic handwriting recognition blackboard eraser, enhancing teaching efficiency and reducing health risks. Lead the team to analysis the balckboard market and predict the future trend of market growth
highlights: Saved 3-5 minutes of class time for teachers.

Projects.name: Research on Improved RSA Cryptography (Published in IJHSR)
Projects.summary: Improved RSA cryptography system by analyzed 50 papers, enhanced security, and reduced decryption time; completed course and submitted on IJHSR.
highlights: Enhanced Standard RSA System encryption security and decryption efficiency

Projects.name: Research of Power Line Communication and Improved OFDM Algorithm
Projects.summary: Studied novel OFDM and power line communication techniques to increase PLC efficiency, publishing research on an improved OFDM synchronization algorithm.

Projects.name: Dandelion Dispersion Modeling (HIMCM)
Projects.summary: Studied dispersion patterns of dandelions using mathematical models and wrote a research paper.
highlights: Completed research paper on invasive factors of dandelion and other invasive plants.

Projects.name: Carbon Dioxide Reduction Measures Modeling (IMMC)
Projects.summary: Investigated and modeled the effectiveness of carbon dioxide reduction measures in factories, proposing innovative methods.
highlights: Completed research paper on CO2 reduction.

volunteer.summary: Organized a two-year online English reading tutoring program, reaching about 300 participants in rural areas.
Managed concert logistics, ticketing, and audience coordination while performing musical compositions.

awards.title: S.T. Yau High School Science Bronze Award
awards.summary: Awarded for exceptional performance in science research (Top 1%).

awards.title: High School Mathematical Contest in Modeling(HIMCM) M Prize
National Economic Competition World Microeconomics Top 3, Macroeconomics Top 10, and Overall World Top 5
awards.summary: Ranked in the top three globally in Microeconomics.

awards.title: International Math Modeling Competition (IMMC) Outstanding Prize
awards.summary: Awarded for innovative solutions in mathematical modeling (Top 1%).

awards.title: Conrad Competition National Shortlist
awards.summary: Recognized for innovative contributions to smart blackboard development.

awards.title: USAD Mathematics National Silver Award(Top 3%); Global round shortlist.
awards.summary: Award for Top score in Mathematics Competition

extracurricular.name: EMPIC (Economic/Mathematics/Physics/Computer Science) STEM Club
extracurricular.summary: Founded a 150-member interdisciplinary club, organized 25 seminars on Bitcoin, game theory, quantum physics, etc., and resulted in 5 research papers.
highlights: 150+ members, 25 seminars, 5 research papers, and 1000+ article page views.

extracurricular.name: Applied Mathematics School Magazine
extracurricular.summary: Published magazines highlighting research in applied mathematics.
highlights: Published three issues in one year.
